featured.text: Researchers at Vanderbilt University are particularly interested in zebrafish retina regeneration.
The structure and cell types of zebrafish retinas are almost identical to those of humans.
Recent studies show that humans and zebrafish have the same major organs and share 70 percent of the genes.
They have learned that damage of retina can cause blindness in zebrafish, yet it only takes about three to four weeks before vision is restored.

other.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding GABA in zebrafish? (A) Increasing GABA level facilitates neuron activities.
They found that lowering GABA levels in zebrafish can trigger retina regeneration, while a high level of GABA concentration will suppress the regeneration process.
What can we learn about zebrafish from the passage?

According to the passage, which of the following is an opinion, but NOT a fact? (A) Humans and zebrafish have 70 percent of genes in common. (B) Zebrafish can quickly recover vision after damage to the retina.
Moreover, 84 percent of human genes associated with disease find a counterpart in zebrafish.

In order to know exactly how zebrafish retina is regenerated, the team looked at the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), a chemical messenger in the brain that reduces the activity of neurons.

definition.zh_def: 斑馬魚，一種小型淡水魚，常用於科學研究，因其透明的胚胎和快速的發育而受到青睞。
definition.en_def: Zebrafish, a small freshwater fish commonly used in scientific research due to its transparent embryos and rapid development.
definition.example: The scientists used zebrafish to study the effects of the new drug on heart development.
